headline: Why Is New York City  So Bad at Recycling?
abstract: New York recycles only about a fifth of its trash, lagging behind other major cities and slowing its quest to reduce waste.
lead_paragraph: If you are a New Yorker and sort your recycling at home, as city law mandates, you probably wonder, as you rinse bottles and stack junk mail and scrub yogurt containers: Does all this effort make a difference?
